prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
```
# Load required libraries
library(openxlsx)
library(dplyr)
library(vegan)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the count table and annotation data
count_table <- read.xlsx("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx", startRow = 2)
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", sep = "\t")

# Extract gene names from the count table
genes <- count_table[, 1]

# Extract group variable from the annotation data
group <- annotation_data$group

# Filter count table and annotation data to include only group-specific genes
group_specific_genes <- apply(count_table[, -1], 2, function(x) {
  groups <- unique(group)
  group_pvalues <- sapply(groups, function(group_name) {
    group_samples <- count_table[, -1][, group == group_name]
    other_samples <- count_table[, -1][, group != group_name]
    p_value <- t.test(group_samples, other_samples)$p.value
    p_value
  })
  p_value_threshold <- 0.05
  group_specific_genes <- genes[group_pvalues < p_value_threshold]
  group_specific_genes
})

# Create a data frame with group-specific genes and group labels
group_specific_genes_df <- data.frame(Genes = unlist(group_specific_genes), Group = group[match(names(unlist(group_specific_genes)), genes)])

# Convert count table into a matrix
count_matrix <- as.matrix(count_table[, -1])

# Perform PCA using group-specific genes
pca <- rda(count_matrix[row.names(count_matrix) %in% group_specific_genes_df$Genes, ])

# Plot PCA with color-coded groups
ggplot(data = as.data.frame(scores(pca)), aes(x = Dim1, y = Dim2, color = Group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2") +
  scale_color_brewer(palette = "Set1")
```

Please make sure to install the required libraries (`openxlsx`, `dplyr`, `vegan`, `ggplot2`) before running the code.
